com.here.android.mpa.routing

Class RouteElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteElement

  • public final class RouteElement
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an element within a Route. Please note that RouteElements are also associated with Maneuver instances within a Route.
    See Also:
    Route, Maneuver

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RouteElement.TravelDirection
      Represents values describing the possible travel directions of a RouteElement.
      static class  RouteElement.Type
      Represents values describing the possible types of a RouteElement.

      Returns the RoadElement associated with this RouteElement.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public RouteElement.Type getType()
        Gets the type of the RouteElement
        Returns:
        type of the RouteElement

      • getRoadElement

        public RoadElement getRoadElement()
        Returns the RoadElement associated with this RouteElement. Each route element has an associated road element.
        Returns:
        the associated RoadElement.

      • getTransitElement

        public TransitRouteElement getTransitElement()
        Returns the TransitRouteElement associated with this RouteElement
        Returns:
        the associated TransitRouteElement. null if RouteElement.getType() is not RouteElement.Type.TRANSIT

      • getGeometry

        public final java.util.List<GeoCoordinate> getGeometry()
        Returns the geometry of the route element. The geometry is a returned as a list of GeoCoordinate that can be used to create a polyline.
        Returns:
        a list of GeoCoordinate

      • getTravelDirection

        public RouteElement.TravelDirection getTravelDirection()
        Gets the travel direction (either FORWARD or BACKWARD) for the route on a given RoadElement. The primary use case for this value is when wanting to calculate a new route which matches the current route or a portion of the current route. Waypoints may be specified using a RoadElement Identifier and this travelDirection value and then used as stops when calculating the new route.
        Returns:
        a RouteElement.TravelDirection.
